{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3156307,"name":"Adam Azevedo","username":"aze12345","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/a4c791/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-03T01:57:40.626Z","cooked":"

Hi everyone.

Looking for some help with SysId. We are trying to characterize a West Coast drive driven by two pairs of falcons. After configuring the encoders, gear ratios, etc., we are able to run the quasistatic and dynamic characterizations. However, the prompt at the end of the test shows different encoder travel distances (~8.5m for dynamic vs 14m for quasistatic).

We believe the drive train and encoders are set up properly: when we use encoder counts to calculate our own odometry, everything lines up (sums to 0 when we return to the same spot).

Any ideas why SysId is reporting inconsistent values? This inaccuracy also seems to reflect in our drivetrain characterization constants, which means we can’t perform accurate spline movements. Any help would be appreciated, thank you in advance!

The screenshots below include our sysid setup and screenshots from each of the 4 tests (we have also ran the test suite many times with pretty consistent results in this regard). The top two tests are quasistatic results, and the bottom two are dynamic results, and the middle part is SYSID config. I’m a new user so I have to upload it in one image.

Screen Shot 2023-03-02 at 5.53.59 PM1698×1062 116 KB

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2023-03-03T01:57:40.626Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":23,"reads":81,"readers_count":80,"score":146.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":428737,"topic_slug":"help-sysid-characterization-issues","display_username":"Adam Azevedo","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/8/d/8d9a8df83f563cda619c5eeae4bd7274174a1573.jpeg","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57687,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/help-sysid-characterization-issues/428737/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3156309,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-03T02:00:41.575Z","cooked":"

The distances shown are based on actual distance traveled during the test. You should be running 4 tests (dynamic/quasistatic vs forward/reverse), and each will have different (but likely similar) run lengths as they’re human-controlled. Comparing the two like that isn’t particularly useful, but comparing each distance against real-world travel distance is.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2023-03-03T02:21:47.315Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":65,"readers_count":64,"score":43.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":428737,"topic_slug":"help-sysid-characterization-issues","display_username":"Fletch","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9105,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades"},"post_url":"/t/help-sysid-characterization-issues/428737/2","custom_user_title":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3156359,"name":"Adam Azevedo","username":"aze12345","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/a4c791/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-03T03:06:07.568Z","cooked":"

To clarify, we did measure against real world distances and 14 meters (the dynamic test) aligns with what we would expect and 8 meters (quasistatic) does not. Both quasistatic and dynamic were run over the same distance. We are wondering why the huge descrepency exists and we think it is messing with our characterization values.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2023-03-03T03:07:07.316Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":56,"readers_count":55,"score":16.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":428737,"topic_slug":"help-sysid-characterization-issues","display_username":"Adam Azevedo","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":9105,"username":"Fletch1373","name":"Fletch","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57687,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/help-sysid-characterization-issues/428737/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3156377,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-03T03:19:07.218Z","cooked":"

If both (all 4?) tests were run with the same configuration, then there’s nothing that should cause a difference between actual and measured distances. That said, i would simply re-run the test.

If it continues to follow the same pattern, I’d say that’s weird and would like to know more about your robot (motors, controllers, gear ratio, wheel size/type, frame dimensions, weight distribution, etc)

Unfortunately we have already run both these tests multiple times across two different drivetrains and observed the same discrepancy. Once again extremely puzzled since when we do our own odometry, despite running at an extreme variety of accelerations and velocities, we get fairly accurate results.
